data.chText: 我戴这顶帽子看上去很可笑。
data.enText: I look ridiculous in this hat.

data.chText: 别犯傻了！怎么能花50英镑买一件T恤衫！
data.enText: Don't be ridiculous! You can't pay £50 for a T-shirt!
from the sublime to the ridiculous

data.chText: 从高超到荒谬；从高妙到低俗
data.enText: used to describe a situation in which sth serious, important or of high quality is followed by sth silly, unimportant or of poor quality

simple_means.memory_skill: ridicul〔e〕嘲笑 + ous …的，ridicule的形容词 → 可笑的

data.enText: from the sublime to the ridiculous

data.chText: 从高超到荒谬；从高妙到低俗
data.enText: used to describe a situation in which sth serious, important or of high quality is followed by sth silly, unimportant or of poor quality

example: how silly an ardent and unsuccessful wooer can be especially if he is getting on in years"- Dashiell Hammet
the wild farcical exuberance of a clown
the absurd excuse that the dog ate his homework
ask a nonsensical question and get a nonsensical answer
a contribution so small as to be laughable
it is ludicrous to call a cottage a mansion
a preposterous attempt to turn back the pages of history
her conceited assumption of universal interest in her rather dull children was ridiculous

value.def: If you say that something or someone is ridiculous, you mean that they are very foolish.

example.ex: It is ridiculous to suggest we are having a romance...
example.tran: 暗示我们正在谈恋爱的说法真是太荒谬了。

example.ex: It was an absolutely ridiculous decision.
example.tran: 这是一个绝对荒谬的决定。

partsOfSpeech.dec: de 坏 + rid 笑 + e → 坏笑 → 嘲笑
de 坏 + ris 笑 + ive …的 → 嘲笑的；可笑的
rid 笑 + icu + le 表反复，连续 → 笑个不停 → 嘲笑
ridicul〔e〕嘲笑 + ous …的，ridicule的形容词 → 可笑的
ris 笑 + ibility 易…性 → 爱笑
ris 笑 + ible …的 → 爱笑的
